fields.title: Minions: The Rise of Gru
fields.review: “The Rise of Gru” isn’t a complete waste; there’s the occasional inspired sight gag, particularly the prop work in the martial arts training sequence, and Arkin seems to have a good time (it’s surprising he hasn’t done more voice work).

fields.title: Scream 5
fields.review: All that's lacking is a plot, or a heroine, capable of making us squeal.

fields.title: Thor: Love and Thunder
fields.review: What makes the film durable and winning is the rare blend of comedy and serious drama weight, which is pushed through by a game cast.

fields.title: The Batman
fields.review: What this film does achieve, however, is telling a solid new Batman story, one with some pretty compelling twists and a strong point-of-view on who, exactly, the Caped Crusader is. By default, that makes it one of the better Batman movies ever made.

fields.title: Turnig Red
fields.review: a funny, compassionate and intelligent animated coming-of-age film with art that communicates the beauty of Chinese culture… addresses the myriad, complex, feelings and sensations of puberty and adolescence with honesty and sensitivity to nuance

fields.title: Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness
fields.review: “Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness” eliminates the playful idiosyncrasy in the interest of formula—of Marvel’s self-perpetuating business. The new film isn’t merely branded entertainment; it’s branding as entertainment.

fields.title: Jurassic World Dominion
fields.review: While there’s never really a sense of true danger for our heroes, we get just enough of the range of CGI dinosaurs and their weird traits to keep the film entertaining.

fields.title: The Adam Project
fields.review: I enjoyed The Adam Project, its past, present, and future permutations an exciting joyride fit for the whole family.

fields.title: Uncharted
fields.review: It’s all mildly amusing, mildly exciting and entirely routine.

fields.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 2
fields.review: a globe-trotting adventure that touches on fun ideas for viewers of all ages, even if the film is too long and jarring to stick the landing.
